intro: Melanthera pungens, commonly known as the prickly goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Melanthera pungens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various healing purposes.
